'''Medb''' ([[Old Irish]] spelling, {{IPA-ga|mÉÃ°v|pron}}) – [[Middle Irish]]: '''Meá¸á¸''', '''Meaá¸á¸'''; early modern Irish: '''Meadhbh''' ({{IPA-ga|mÉÉ£v|pron}}); reformed modern Irish '''MÃ©abh''' ({{IPA-ga|mÊ²eËv|}}); sometimes Anglicised '''Maeve''', '''Maev''' or '''Maive''' ({{IPA-en|ËmeÉªv|pron}}) – is [[Queen regnant|queen]] of [[Connacht]] in the [[Ulster Cycle]] of [[Irish mythology]]. Her husband in the core stories of the cycle is [[Ailill mac MÃ¡ta]], although she had several husbands before him who were also kings of Connacht. She rules from [[Cruachan, Ireland|Cruachan]] (now Rathcroghan, [[County Roscommon]]). She is the enemy (and former wife) of [[Conchobar mac Nessa]], king of Ulster, and is best known for starting the ''[[TÃ¡in BÃ³ CÃºailnge]]'' ("The Cattle Raid of Cooley") to steal Ulster's prize stud bull.
